result.execSummary:
The defendant William R Barton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 2 years bifurcated sentence.  Credit given below is not duplicate to 15CF347.
Consecutive to: to 15CF347

superMiscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample as required by law and pay assessed surcharge.  Pay costs of supervision and court obligations.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate, specifically sex offender treatment and cognitive programming.  Follow through with recommendations.  No contact, directly or indirectly, with victim or child named in 15CF347 without prior approval of agent.  Must comply with rules and regulations of the Sex Offender Registry.  Voting prohibited until sentence has been completed and civil rights are restored.  Firearm prohibition warning given.
